R.content: voyoute, extremely rare word, artificial, a bit tomboyish, free & master of her own like man, air of liberated feminist—but voyou is always a man if not a ladies’ man
R.linkedContent: voyoute, extremely rare word, artificial, a bit tomboyish, free & master of her own like man, air of liberated feminist—but voyou is always a man if not a ladies’ man

SP.content: mustn’t we reconcile Nietzsche’s apparently feminist propositions w/ his overwhelming corpus of “venomous (acharné) anti-feminism” > question still remains: de ce que je fais ici en ce moment
SP.linkedContent: mustn’t we reconcile Nietzsche’s apparently feminist propositions w/ his overwhelming corpus of “venomous (acharné) anti-feminism” > question still remains: de ce que je fais ici en ce moment

SP.content: for Nietzsche, since man alone believes in woman-truth, women feminists are men too, lay claim to truth > perd le style (gone the style)
SP.linkedContent: for Nietzsche, since man alone believes in woman-truth, women feminists are men too, lay claim to truth > perd le style (gone the style)

AD.content: is Levinas’ feminine an androcentric hyperbole or a feminist manifesto? can one decide?
AD.linkedContent: is Levinas’ feminine an androcentric hyperbole or a feminist manifesto? can one decide?

AD.content: feminine not empirical for Levinas, thought of welcome opens ethics, it’s marked by sexual difference (it will thus never again be neutralized) [v. different take from ATM?], this hospitality that precedes property can’t be appropriated
AD.linkedContent: feminine not empirical for Levinas, thought of welcome opens ethics, it’s marked by sexual difference (it will thus never again be neutralized) [v. different take from ATM?], this hospitality that precedes property can’t be appropriated

CIN.content: Woolf: “incarnadine the willows…for we have done with this ‘education’!”
CIN.linkedContent: Woolf: “incarnadine the willows…for we have done with this ‘education’!”

EU.content: Descartes and feminism: intelligible order has no sexual marks [cogito is “desexed,” w/out body, sexually neutral or indifferent]
EU.linkedContent: Descartes and feminism: intelligible order has no sexual marks [cogito is “desexed,” w/out body, sexually neutral or indifferent]

EU.content: which is feminist: learn Latin? or be talked down to in vulgar language?
EU.linkedContent: which is feminist: learn Latin? or be talked down to in vulgar language?

WBH.content: guardians of institution are guardians of Law > as women’s studies gains institutional legitimacy, it produces guardians of the Law; U.S. is a pioneer of women’s studies
WBH.linkedContent: guardians of institution are guardians of Law > as women’s studies gains institutional legitimacy, it produces guardians of the Law; U.S. is a pioneer of women’s studies

WBH.content: U.S. more faithful to 19th century model of University than most European countries
WBH.linkedContent: U.S. more faithful to 19th century model of University than most European countries

WBH.content: insidiously reproduce the old model (fundamentally phallogocentric) in modern University > would women’s studies become another cell in university beehive [?]
WBH.linkedContent: insidiously reproduce the old model (fundamentally phallogocentric) in modern University > would women’s studies become another cell in university beehive [?]

WBH.content: women’s studies has uplifted from repression all sorts of forbidden feminine signatures
WBH.linkedContent: women’s studies has uplifted from repression all sorts of forbidden feminine signatures

WBH.content: the more proofs women’s studies brings to masculine directors of university (masculine, whether man or woman), the more women’s studies is legitimized by power of university, more it risks repressing fundamental question that must be posed
WBH.linkedContent: the more proofs women’s studies brings to masculine directors of university (masculine, whether man or woman), the more women’s studies is legitimized by power of university, more it risks repressing fundamental question that must be posed

WBH.content: as members of a university, we are all guardians of Law, and also naive in front of text, in front of Law [like both characters in Kafka’s “Before the Law”]; p. 193 Law in Kafka’s story neither male nor female
WBH.linkedContent: as members of a university, we are all guardians of Law, and also naive in front of text, in front of Law [like both characters in Kafka’s “Before the Law”]; p. 193 Law in Kafka’s story neither male nor female

WBH.content: 1) positive/optimistic deconstruction: not submit to law 2) pessimistic deconstruction (more conscious of law of Law): radically deconstruct old model of university, not to open a field w/out law but new relation to Law, rediscover the Law—yet, no longer bored [?]
WBH.linkedContent: 1) positive/optimistic deconstruction: not submit to law 2) pessimistic deconstruction (more conscious of law of Law): radically deconstruct old model of university, not to open a field w/out law but new relation to Law, rediscover the Law—yet, no longer bored [?]

WBH.content: is it only a question of strategy, isn’t strategy the real risk?
WBH.linkedContent: is it only a question of strategy, isn’t strategy the real risk?

WBH.content: to say woman is not a “subject,” 2 consequences: 1) radically revolutionary or deconstructive 2) dangerously reactive
WBH.linkedContent: to say woman is not a “subject,” 2 consequences: 1) radically revolutionary or deconstructive 2) dangerously reactive

WBH.content: to say women are subjects keeps whole framework on which traditional university is built
WBH.linkedContent: to say women are subjects keeps whole framework on which traditional university is built

WBH.content: classical ruse of neutralization/neuterization (of sexual marks): “I think” is neither man nor woman, but we can verify that it’s already man
WBH.linkedContent: classical ruse of neutralization/neuterization (of sexual marks): “I think” is neither man nor woman, but we can verify that it’s already man

WBH.content: to say woman is on side of undecidability has only meaning of strategical phase, the side of woman becomes the side from which you begin to dismantle structure > but, as soon as you reach first stage of deconstruction, opposition man/woman no longer pertinent
WBH.linkedContent: to say woman is on side of undecidability has only meaning of strategical phase, the side of woman becomes the side from which you begin to dismantle structure > but, as soon as you reach first stage of deconstruction, opposition man/woman no longer pertinent

WBH.content: “woman” no longer best trope to refer to these things, same goes for undecidability itself!
WBH.linkedContent: “woman” no longer best trope to refer to these things, same goes for undecidability itself!

WBH.content: there’re many undecidables, one undecidability acts as a program, programming or unprogramming a program
WBH.linkedContent: there’re many undecidables, one undecidability acts as a program, programming or unprogramming a program

WBH.content: resistance opposed to deconstruction same as one opposed to woman’s studies, “something sexual at stake in the resistance to deconstruction,” deconstruction successful in U.S. among homosexuals, feminists
WBH.linkedContent: resistance opposed to deconstruction same as one opposed to woman’s studies, “something sexual at stake in the resistance to deconstruction,” deconstruction successful in U.S. among homosexuals, feminists

WBH.content: gift beyond sexual duality > Heidegger’s attempt to neutralize sexual opposition and not sexual difference, liberating field of sexuality for very different sexuality, more multiple: no more sexes, one sex for each time, each gift, a sexual difference for each gift
WBH.linkedContent: gift beyond sexual duality > Heidegger’s attempt to neutralize sexual opposition and not sexual difference, liberating field of sexuality for very different sexuality, more multiple: no more sexes, one sex for each time, each gift, a sexual difference for each gift

WBH.content: deconstruction [re: women’s studies], occupies both places, thus it is conservative and not conservative
WBH.linkedContent: deconstruction [re: women’s studies], occupies both places, thus it is conservative and not conservative

WBH.content: “woman” as “truth,” as that which stops the drift, but what about truth as movement of the drift [?]
WBH.linkedContent: “woman” as “truth,” as that which stops the drift, but what about truth as movement of the drift [?]

CIR.content: my absolute knowledge: writing promised unto death, writing that must come to an end > any reader (addressee) becoming the uncircumcised [son] to be confessed—line thrown to girl-martyrs [wondering why they’re reading Derrida]
CIR.linkedContent: my absolute knowledge: writing promised unto death, writing that must come to an end > any reader (addressee) becoming the uncircumcised [son] to be confessed—line thrown to girl-martyrs [wondering why they’re reading Derrida]

CHOR.content: [quoted from SP] that which will not be pinned down by truth, is, in truth, feminine, but this should not be mistaken for woman’s femininity, nor female sexuality, by dogmatic philosopher, impotent artist, or inexperienced seducer still hoping to capture
CHOR.linkedContent: [quoted from SP] that which will not be pinned down by truth, is, in truth, feminine, but this should not be mistaken for woman’s femininity, nor female sexuality, by dogmatic philosopher, impotent artist, or inexperienced seducer still hoping to capture

CHOR.content: once feminism movements reappropriate stifled past, feminism will perhaps have to renounce all too easy progressivism
CHOR.linkedContent: once feminism movements reappropriate stifled past, feminism will perhaps have to renounce all too easy progressivism

CHOR.content: “dogmatics” of feminism as telos, sinister mystification, will flounder in same homogenized, sterilized river of history of mankind [w/ its age-old dream of reappropriation]
CHOR.linkedContent: “dogmatics” of feminism as telos, sinister mystification, will flounder in same homogenized, sterilized river of history of mankind [w/ its age-old dream of reappropriation]

CHOR.content: specular reversal of masculine “subjectivity” (even in its most self-critical form, when most jealous of itself and its “proper” objects) represents only one phase of feminism?
CHOR.linkedContent: specular reversal of masculine “subjectivity” (even in its most self-critical form, when most jealous of itself and its “proper” objects) represents only one phase of feminism?

CHOR.content: perhaps Emma Goldman, wanting only a revolution to dance in, was thinking of tout autre history, w/ paradoxical laws, non-dialectical discontinuities, absolutely heterogenous pockets, incalculable sexual differences [Derrida’s own dream?]
CHOR.linkedContent: perhaps Emma Goldman, wanting only a revolution to dance in, was thinking of tout autre history, w/ paradoxical laws, non-dialectical discontinuities, absolutely heterogenous pockets, incalculable sexual differences [Derrida’s own dream?]

CHOR.content: to say ironically, “there is no one place for woman,” is neither anti-feminist nor feminist, is faithful to affirmative displacement: “dancing” of women
CHOR.linkedContent: to say ironically, “there is no one place for woman,” is neither anti-feminist nor feminist, is faithful to affirmative displacement: “dancing” of women

CHOR.content: there is a “reactive” feminism that even gains power today—that’s what Nietzsche mocks, and not woman or women [?]
CHOR.linkedContent: there is a “reactive” feminism that even gains power today—that’s what Nietzsche mocks, and not woman or women [?]

CHOR.content: lack of place, madness of dance, can also serve as alibi for deserting organized, patient, laborious “feminist” struggle
CHOR.linkedContent: lack of place, madness of dance, can also serve as alibi for deserting organized, patient, laborious “feminist” struggle

CHOR.content: poker-like gamble w/ no insurance: “each man and each woman must commit his or her own singularity, the untranslatable factor of his or her life and death”
CHOR.linkedContent: poker-like gamble w/ no insurance: “each man and each woman must commit his or her own singularity, the untranslatable factor of his or her life and death”

CHOR.content: worldwide feminism can’t be separated from fundamental Europeanization of world culture
CHOR.linkedContent: worldwide feminism can’t be separated from fundamental Europeanization of world culture

CHOR.content: some can’t see beyond end of phallic forms in SP (bisexual complication of style, spur, umbrella): those people do not read the syntax and punctuation of a given sentence, arresting the text in a position, settling on a thesis, meaning or truth
CHOR.linkedContent: some can’t see beyond end of phallic forms in SP (bisexual complication of style, spur, umbrella): those people do not read the syntax and punctuation of a given sentence, arresting the text in a position, settling on a thesis, meaning or truth

CHOR.content: “phallogocentrism,” complicity of Western metaphysics w/ notion of male firstness > mistakes/anchorings of Western rationality assuage hermeneutic anxiety
CHOR.linkedContent: “phallogocentrism,” complicity of Western metaphysics w/ notion of male firstness > mistakes/anchorings of Western rationality assuage hermeneutic anxiety

CHOR.content: “essentializing fetishes” (truth, femininity, essentiality of woman or feminine sexuality as fetishes)—but one must be precise about fetishism [i.e. general fetishism in Glas], and its context, if only to displace it
CHOR.linkedContent: “essentializing fetishes” (truth, femininity, essentiality of woman or feminine sexuality as fetishes)—but one must be precise about fetishism [i.e. general fetishism in Glas], and its context, if only to displace it

CHOR.content: how can one breathe w/out punctuation, w/out multiplicities of rhythm, steps, how can one dance?
CHOR.linkedContent: how can one breathe w/out punctuation, w/out multiplicities of rhythm, steps, how can one dance?

CHOR.content: [cf. WBH p. 198] could femininity, however irreducible it may be, remain derived from or subordinated to question of destination or thought of gift?
CHOR.linkedContent: [cf. WBH p. 198] could femininity, however irreducible it may be, remain derived from or subordinated to question of destination or thought of gift?

CHOR.content: Derrida introduced 2 phases of deconstruction for sake of clarity: 1) woman reverses structure & becomes dominant 2) “new” concept is forged
CHOR.linkedContent: Derrida introduced 2 phases of deconstruction for sake of clarity: 1) woman reverses structure & becomes dominant 2) “new” concept is forged

CHOR.content: new “concept” of woman? was there ever an old one? [deconstruct concept of concept]
CHOR.linkedContent: new “concept” of woman? was there ever an old one? [deconstruct concept of concept]

CHOR.content: when sexual difference is determined by opposition, acc. Hegelian dialectics, destines sexual difference for truth—in order to erase/neutralize sexual difference [in masculine sex?]
CHOR.linkedContent: when sexual difference is determined by opposition, acc. Hegelian dialectics, destines sexual difference for truth—in order to erase/neutralize sexual difference [in masculine sex?]

CHOR.content: phallogocentrism, “patrix,” is insurance against return of that which is feared as most agonizing risk
CHOR.linkedContent: phallogocentrism, “patrix,” is insurance against return of that which is feared as most agonizing risk

CHOR.content: very obscure area, passage btwn ontological difference & sexual difference not punctuated by polarities (originary/derived, ontological/ontic…)
CHOR.linkedContent: very obscure area, passage btwn ontological difference & sexual difference not punctuated by polarities (originary/derived, ontological/ontic…)

CHOR.content: “hymen,” “invagination,” part of Derrida’s attempt to re-sexualize philosophical/theoretical discourse, but these terms no longer simply designate figures of feminine body: what remains undecidable concerns [but not only] line of cleavage btwn 2 sexes
CHOR.linkedContent: “hymen,” “invagination,” part of Derrida’s attempt to re-sexualize philosophical/theoretical discourse, but these terms no longer simply designate figures of feminine body: what remains undecidable concerns [but not only] line of cleavage btwn 2 sexes

CHOR.content: hymen does not exist, anything constituting value of existence is foreign to “hymen,” so how could one then attribute existence of hymen properly to woman? (same goes for invagination)
CHOR.linkedContent: hymen does not exist, anything constituting value of existence is foreign to “hymen,” so how could one then attribute existence of hymen properly to woman? (same goes for invagination)

CHOR.content: invagination is always taken w/in syntax of expression “double chiasmatic invagination of borders,” doubly folded, redoubled, inversed: can we still recognize “representation of woman” in this movement?
CHOR.linkedContent: invagination is always taken w/in syntax of expression “double chiasmatic invagination of borders,” doubly folded, redoubled, inversed: can we still recognize “representation of woman” in this movement?

CHOR.content: questions of representation [of women] always too old & as yet to be born, overloaded w/ hieroglyphs & still as virgin as origin, like early morning in East
CHOR.linkedContent: questions of representation [of women] always too old & as yet to be born, overloaded w/ hieroglyphs & still as virgin as origin, like early morning in East

CHOR.content: no monological discourse, no mono-sexual discourse, necessity for a chorus, a choreographic text w/ polysexual signatures
CHOR.linkedContent: no monological discourse, no mono-sexual discourse, necessity for a chorus, a choreographic text w/ polysexual signatures

CHOR.content: certain dissymmetry is law of sexual difference & relation to other (Derrida says this in opposition to violence of “democratic” platitudes), dissymmetry as inordinate, excessive, goes beyond coded marks, beyond grammar & spelling of sexuality
CHOR.linkedContent: certain dissymmetry is law of sexual difference & relation to other (Derrida says this in opposition to violence of “democratic” platitudes), dissymmetry as inordinate, excessive, goes beyond coded marks, beyond grammar & spelling of sexuality

CHOR.content: in dreaming of saving the chance [of deconstructing sexuality], Derrida would like to believe in multiplicity of sexually marked voices, desire for sexuality w/out # can protect us, like a dream, from an implacable destiny that immures us (everything in life) in #2
CHOR.linkedContent: in dreaming of saving the chance [of deconstructing sexuality], Derrida would like to believe in multiplicity of sexually marked voices, desire for sexuality w/out # can protect us, like a dream, from an implacable destiny that immures us (everything in life) in #2

CHOR.content: if merciless closure [of the 2] would arrest desire at wall of opposition, there would never be but 2 > tragedy would leave this strange sense, a contingent one, that we must affirm & learn to love instead of dreaming of innumerable: but doesn’t dream prove what is dreamt of?
CHOR.linkedContent: if merciless closure [of the 2] would arrest desire at wall of opposition, there would never be but 2 > tragedy would leave this strange sense, a contingent one, that we must affirm & learn to love instead of dreaming of innumerable: but doesn’t dream prove what is dreamt of?

CHOR.content: desire to escape combinatory itself, to invent incalculable choreographies, would remain—even beyond exchange of sexes w/ considerably varied rhythms
CHOR.linkedContent: desire to escape combinatory itself, to invent incalculable choreographies, would remain—even beyond exchange of sexes w/ considerably varied rhythms
